description.narrative: Activities will contribute to building the capacity of developing countries to better manage their coral reefs by sharing knowledge, experience and innovation between countries in the International Coral Reef Initiative (ICRI) during Australia's co-secretariat term of ICRI. Activities include technical support to developing country members of ICRI to protect and manage coral reefs that provide significant economic and livelihood benefits to communities. Australia will also support eligible developing country delegates to attend ICRI events to build their capacity in managing coral reefs by exposing them to international experts through seminars, workshops, and peer-to-peer exchanges, as well as allowing developing country delegates to present at international fora. The implementing agencies will provide contributions to meet non-ODA eligible components, including support to achieve global ICRI objectives and to support implementation of activities not related to developing countries.
